intro: Bennettiodendron leprosipes var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy bennettiodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Thailand and Vietnam, where it thrives in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves with a hairy underside, and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
